text: Epipsestis nigropunctata is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It is found in China, Japan, 1941, Deutsche Entomologische Zeitschrift Iris 1941: 5. (Hokkaido, Honshu, Shikoku), Korea, the Russian Far East and Nepal. The larvae feed on Quercus mongolica.A review of the Thyatirin-moths (Lepidoptera, Drepanidae: Thyatirinae) of the Russian Far East ==Subspecies== *Epipsestis nigropunctata nigropunctata (Nepal, China: Yunnan) *Epipsestis nigropunctata perornata Inoue, 1972 (south-eastern Russia, Japan, Korean Peninsula, China: Shaanxi) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1941 Category:Thyatirinae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Epipsestis nigropunctata
